block.p: Heather Renee French, Miss America 2000, and Dr. Stephen L. Henry, the lieutenant governor of Kentucky, were married on Friday at the Roman Catholic Cathedral of the Assumption in Louisville. The Rev. Dave Stone, an evangelical Christian minister, performed the ceremony with the Rev. Byron Z. Mills, a nondenominational Christian minister.

Mrs. Henry, 25, graduated from the University of Cincinnati, where she is a candidate for a master's degree in fashion design and illustration. She is a daughter of Diana and Ron E. French of Maysville, Ky. Her father, a Vietnam veteran, is a speaker on homelessness, post-traumatic stress disorder and other veterans' issues.

Heather Renee French, Miss America 2000, and Dr. Stephen L. Henry, the lieutenant governor of Kentucky, were married on Friday at the Roman Catholic Cathedral of the Assumption in Louisville. The Rev. Dave Stone, an evangelical Christian minister, performed the ceremony with the Rev. Byron Z. Mills, a nondenominational Christian minister.

Mrs. Henry, 25, graduated from the University of Cincinnati, where she is a candidate for a master's degree in fashion design and illustration. She is a daughter of Diana and Ron E. French of Maysville, Ky. Her father, a Vietnam veteran, is a speaker on homelessness, post-traumatic stress disorder and other veterans' issues.

Dr. Henry, 47, is also the chairman of the National Conference of Lieutenant Governors and an orthopedic surgeon on the staff of the University of Louisville Hospital. He graduated from Western Kentucky University and received a medical degree from the University of Louisville. He is the son of Wanda Henry of Owensboro, Ky., and the late Virgil Henry. His mother retired as a business teacher at Owensboro High School. His father was a chemical engineer in Owensboro for W. R. Grace & Company.
